page.title: 13LANDSCAPE THE GREEN, TILSTON
page.content: Tilston Village Green _____________________ Tilston village green is in the centre of the village. It has a beautiful chestnut tree in the middle. Mr. Tyrie planted the tree 30 years ago. Children collect conkers from the tree in the autumn. Nearby are ancient stone{stocks.}Teenagers meet there and deposit litter there. Next to the stocks are two wooden seats. On the village green can be found the two village pubs, the FOX AND HOUNDS and the CARDEN ARMS. The FOX AND HOUNDS has been named because the hunt meet there. The CARDEN ARMS is named after Carden Hall owned by the{Leche}family. Carden Hall was destroyed by fire in 1913. Bank Farm has dairy cows. At the {"Wakes",}adults and the children have a{"pram"}race to Farndon and back. They dress up in fancy costumes.
